name: Fairness-Aware AI-Generated Face Detection
description: Detect whether a facial image is real or AI-generated while ensuring fairness across demographic groups.

cr:input.name: competition_dataset
cr:input.description: Cropped face images and associated demographic annotations in CSV format. Example columns: id (string), image_path (path to cropped face image), real_or_fake (binary label: 0=real, 1=fake), generation_method (Deepfake, GAN, DM), skin_tone (Tone 1-10), gender (binary: 1=male, 0=female), age (categorical: 0=child, 1=youth, 2=adult, 3=middle-age adult, 4=senior).

cr:output.name: predictions
cr:output.description: Predictions for real/fake classification, generation method classification, and demographic attributes (skin tone, gender, age). Example values: real_or_fake=1, generation_method=GAN, skin_tone=5, gender=1, age=2.

field.name: generation_method
field.description: Generation method classification: Deepfake, GAN, DM

cr:evaluation.notes: Utility metrics (e.g., AUC, accuracy) are higher-is-better, while fairness metrics (e.g., FDP, FMEO) are lower-is-better.

open_questions: What is the exact URL for the AI-Face dataset?
What are the exact versions of PyTorch and other packages required?
Are participants allowed to use external data for training or fine-tuning?
fill_in_the_blank: cr:input[0].url - dataset URL not specified in paper
cr:execution.allowedExternalData - external data usage policy not specified
